content.description:
This is named Mac's Super Gloss for a reason: Thin, slippery, and tenuous (once you get above the third bolt, it's easy gear to the top).

As of 6/2020, no one has sent this yet. Can you? You should!
content.protection: Three bolts, gear to 2, chains on top.
content.location: Up the trail, past the Mac's Super Gloss Carwash bucket and right of the Mario Land boulders. About a 10-minute approach from the road.

content.description: Some stemming, some jamming, and a fun, exposed, bolt-protected crux.
content.protection: Five bolts and a bomber .4 (or a less bomber 2 or 3 slightly lower)Â between the first and second bolt, chains on top.
content.location: The (mostly) bolted route left of Belated Birthday Crack.

content.description:
Good jamming and great gear all the way -- this thing is as good as it looks! Local crusher/guy-about-town, Jake, describes B.B.C. as ... "mega."

Head up the left-leaning crack, 5.8-ish, at the top of the crack move right into the right-leaning/arching crack, jug 'n' jam up and over the bulge (crux), and up the corner to the chains.
content.location: Up the trail, left past the Mario Land boulders, and up to the wall, about a five-minute approach from the road.
